subject: RE: [junit] Creating unit tests for non returning methods
msgSnippet: 1) Test whatever impact the method has on the system.  It must do something, otherwise it wouldn t exist.  If it enters data into a database, then do a
messageBody:
1) Test whatever impact the method has on the system. It must do
something, otherwise it wouldn't exist. If it enters data into a
database, then do a before-and-after comparison of the database, for
instance.

2) Definitely not. You can test methods of any kind with JUnit, even
those that don't have a return value.


Todd.


________________________________

From: nyhockeyfan1994 [mailto:nyhockeyfan1994@...]
Sent: Monday, February 21, 2005 3:00 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Creating unit tests for non returning methods




Hello All,

I have used JUnit before, however I have been unable to figure
out how
to test methods that don't have a return value. How do you test
those
types of methods? Do all methods have to return a value to be
able to
develop a test for it?

-Paul
